questionsData.title: One of the common alkalis is vinegar.
Fresh food in the freezer becomes liquid.
Sun is the main source of light.
Sound waves cannot travel through a vacuum.
People working with cows suffered from smallpox.
The earth takes its light from the moon.
Dresses are made of cloth.
A mule is a cross between a donkey and a camel.
Hills are lower than mountains.
Weatherman is the person who talks about the accident.
Recently, there has been a crime epidemic means uncontrolled crimes.
Medical supplies are like books and pencils.
Anyone who sees an accident is an eye-witness.
Required means not needed.
To be polite is to respect the others.
Adults are children.
Prefix is a group of letters added before the stem of the word.
The word "canning" means "to put in cans".
To kick means to hit with your hand.
"His blood ran cold" means " he got scared"
The text is mainly talking about …
questionsData.article: Tigers are endangered creatures. For many years (they 3) have been hunted for their beautiful fur. A tiger is a fierce, strong cat that hunts in the forests and jungles. A male tiger maybe longer than a car and weighs more than two adult men. Female tigers are smaller than the males. A female tiger is called a tigress. Apart from their size, male and female tigers look the same. A tiger lives in its own special area, this is called territory and it has to be large enough to give the tiger food, water, and shelter. They usually hunt at night. It has long, pointed front teeth, sharp, (curved 2) claws and powerful shoulders. It has to work hard for its (meals 1). It can't run as fast as many of the animals it hunts, so it has to get quite close to them before it pounces

questionsData.title: …… apple a day keeps a doctor away.
Which of the following is a compound word?
They bought new watch last week. The word "watch" is a/an ……
The prefix ……. makes the word "well" negative.
Half a loaf is ……than no bread at all.
Her eyes are …… color as my sister's.
I am grateful ……a quick reply.
Sana'a is the city in ……I was born.
She was driving fast, …… she made an accident.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct answer is "so".

Explanation in English:

The sentence describes a cause-and-effect relationship: she was driving fast, and as a result, she made an accident. The word "so" is used to indicate this result.

  • "so" is used to show the effect of the first action (driving fast led to the accident).
  • "but" is used to show a contrast, which doesn't fit here because the second part is not contrasting with the first part.
  • "however" is also used to show contrast or opposition, which is not the case in this sentence.
  • "because" is used to explain the reason for something, but it doesn't fit the sentence structure here, where we want to show a result, not a cause.

So, the correct sentence is:
"She was driving fast, so she made an accident."

التوضيح بالعربي:

الجملة توضح علاقة سبب ونتيجة: كانت تقود بسرعة، ونتيجة لذلك، وقع الحادث. الكلمة "so" تُستخدم لتوضيح هذه النتيجة.

  • "so" تُستخدم لتوضيح النتيجة الناجمة عن الفعل الأول (القيادة بسرعة أدت إلى الحادث).
  • "but" تُستخدم لتوضيح التناقض، وهو غير مناسب هنا لأن الجزء الثاني لا يتناقض مع الأول.
  • "however" تُستخدم أيضًا لتوضيح التناقض أو المعارضة، وهو غير مناسب في هذه الجملة.
  • "because" تُستخدم لتوضيح السبب، لكنها لا تناسب هيكل الجملة هنا، حيث نريد توضيح النتيجة وليس السبب.

questionsData.title: Injured people should be examined ……
He always …… the truth.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct is "He always tells the truth."

In this sentence, the verb "tell" is used in the present simple tense. When the subject is a third-person singular pronoun (such as "he"), the verb form typically takes an "-s" suffix in the present simple tense. Therefore, "tells" is the correct form in this case.

questionsData.title: The new manager is ……tomorrow.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The new manager is to arrive tomorrow.

The verb to be + to + infinitive

Examples: The President is to meet the ambassador tomorrow.
The thick fog is to clear this afternoon.
You can use these structure to talk about future plans or forecasts. You often
see it in newspaper.

questionsData.title: Stop talking! I can't hear what he ……
questionsData.explain_answer:
Stop talking! I can't hear what he's saying.  (Sense verbs)

  • "Is saying" refers to the present moment, which wouldn't make sense since you're saying you can't hear him.
  • "Has said" refers to something that was already said in the past, but you're indicating you can't hear him right now.
  • "Said" could technically work, but "saying" is more natural-sounding in this context where you want the person to stop talking immediately.
  • "Had said" implies something completed entirely in the past, similar to "has said".

questionsData.title: If there ……no schools, we wouldn't learn.
questionsData.explain_answer:
If there were no schools, we wouldn't learn.

In this sentence, the correct form is "were." It is used in the subjunctive mood to express a hypothetical or unreal condition in the present or future. When talking about unreal or hypothetical situations, we use "were" for all subjects, regardless of whether it is singular or plural.

questionsData.title: All mistakes ……last night.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct is "All mistakes were corrected last night."

In this sentence, the verb "were corrected" is used in the past simple passive voice. The subject "All mistakes" is the receiver of the action, and "were corrected" indicates that the correction took place in the past.

questionsData.title: I have never …… to Egypt.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct is "I have never been to Egypt."

In this sentence, the verb "been" is used in the present perfect tense to indicate an experience or action that has not occurred up until the present moment. "Been" is the past participle form of the verb "to be" and is used to express a state of having visited or traveled to a specific place.

questionsData.title: She saw a thief ……the neighbors window.
questionsData.explain_answer:
She saw a thief breaking the neighbor's window.

In this sentence, "breaking" is the correct form. It is the present participle form of the verb "break."

Even though the main verb "saw" is in the past tense, we use the present participle form "breaking" to describe the ongoing action that the subject (she) witnessed at that time. The present participle form is often used in the present continuous tense to describe actions happening at the time of speaking.

questionsData.title: She …… put enough salt in the soup. It is tasteless.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Modal verbs

There are different ways of talking about how something happened in the past:

- Suggesting a possible explanation-may/might/could + have + past participle
- Deciding on an explanation - must + have + past participle

ex:The sailors cannot/could not have mutinied.
- Not accepting the suggestion or decision - cannot/could not + have + past participle
- Giving reasons for (not) accepting a suggestion or decision - because

questionsData.title: The children made a boat ……
questionsData.explain_answer:
The children made a boat themselves.

In this sentence, the reflexive pronoun "themselves" is used to refer back to the subject "the children." It indicates that the children performed the action of making the boat without any external assistance. The reflexive pronoun "themselves" emphasizes that the subject and the object of the verb are the same.

Reflexive pronouns
The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject of a verb is also the object.

questionsData.title: Ask someone …… you.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Ask someone to help you .

Verb + object + infinitive with to
This is a very common sentence pattern, used with many verbs.
